newsitem.title: SOUTH KOREA: Daewoo confident of China car assembly.
newsitem.headline: Daewoo confident of China car assembly.

text.p: The head of South Korea's Daewoo Group said on Monday he was confident of being able to build a car assembly plant with an annual capacity of 200,000 units in China by 1999.

Group chairman Kim Woo-choong said in an interview with Reuters Daewoo's car component venture, now under construction in the country, would support the group's plan to produce finished cars in China.
"I'm confident of having a finished car plant in China. I've been in China more than 100 times to push the project," Kim said.
"China has great potential. I can see its per-capita income rising to $10,000 by 2010, then its car market will grow to 15 million a year, similar to that of the U.S. or western Europe now," he said.
Kim said the plant, if realised, would be built in a joint venture with one of China's three carmakers.
He also said Daewoo would set up 50 direct sales outlets in the United States to promote Daewoo's car sales in the country.
